td.div:
jbundle core has a simple application model.
You can find these classes in the jbundle-model project (package: org.jbundle.model).

tr.td:
Top level object contains all of the Applications
(optional)
An Application contains all of a single user's Tasks

An independent thread
ie., Applet, Session, or Servlet

A program
ie., Screen or Process

A collections of records
(For navigating through records)

section.name: Implementations
section.p: There are several concrete implementations of this model in the JBundle project:

tr.td:
Thick java client. Functionality and application simplicity are the goal. Currently there are four views:
Java client - This rich client can be deployed as an Web Start Applet or standalone.
Ajax client - This client uses the dojo ajax toolkit
XML client - This client uses apache cocoon to render beautiful web pages
HTML client - Where the user has limited resources and bandwidth
Lightweight java client. Where bandwidth and application speed are a concern.
Remote clients (Thin and Thick Applets as well as remote [SOA] clients).
